SENT.plain: The purpose of this report is to describe the clinical course of a 12% TBSA burn injury with takotsubo cardiomyopathy and to discuss this lesser known diagnosis
The authors performed a case study with retrospective chart review and conducted a literature search
Takotsubo cardiomyopathy is characterized by severe left ventricular dysfunction that is incited by severe psychological or physical stress
The patient's treatment course was complicated by the underlying cardiomyopathy requiring intubation, volume expansion, and vasoactive medications
After treatment for her burn injuries, her cardiac myopathy resolved, and she was discharged home
Takotsubo cardiomyopathy may be precipitated by burn injury
Treatment is supportive, but it should be instituted quickly to avoid complications
